intro: Prunus turcomanica, commonly known as the Turkmenian cherry, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Central Asia. It typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. The plant produces small, sweet fruits that are edible and often used in local cuisines. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a distinctive silvery-white underside. Prunus turcomanica plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
